skillTree.localised_description: The High Elves possess a natural skill that far outstrips the prowess of ordinary mortals.
Panic and fear are things that happen to others.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +10% when fighting against Dark Elves
Attribute: Immune to Psychology when fighting against Dark Elves

skillTree.localised_description: The Trickster God knows all manner of ploys and ruses that can be used to counter missile attacks.
Knowledge can be used as a shield against magical attack.
Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +20%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +35%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Lords

	(Heroes in Lord's army)

	(local region)
Winds of Magic power reserve change: +10% when increasing

skillTree.localised_description: These days Belannaer sits in the White Tower and reflects upon a lifetime of study. He is painfully aware that his duties have not yet ended. He senses that a greater challenge lies ahead, and that his powers will be sorely tested before he is allowed to find peace.

effects.description:
Hero recruit rank: +1 for Mages
	(all provinces)

Hero recruit rank: +2 for Mages
	(all provinces)

skillTree.localised_description: Those who seek wisdom in Saphery will find it. Those who seek power for power's sake are never seen again.

The Kingdom of Saphery is an enchanted land, with skies that shine with all the colours of the rainbow, hills that move by night and warm rivers that glow with gentle light. Magic courses through the blood of Sapherian Elves, and all of the realm's princes are also mages of awesome power.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -25% for all spells

Winds of Magic power reserve change: +15% when increasing
	(armies in local province)

skillTree.localised_description: Belannaer has became a great mage and a teacher of sorcery to true seekers of knowledge. As a frail youth Teclis himself studied at the feet of Belannaer, absorbing and eventually coming to surpass his master's knowledge.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +200
	(armies in local province)

skillTree.localised_description: Belannaer is the oldest living Loremaster of Hoeth, second only in power to the Warden of the White Tower, High Loremaster Teclis himself.

effects.description:
Enemy Winds of Magic power reserve change: -15% when increasing
	(local region)

ui_effects.localised_text: Explosion does not affect friendly troops

skillTree.localised_description: It is rare to encounter two Loremasters who have trodden the same path to illumination. Even to an Elven mind, the realm of knowledge is a labyrinth, and none can explore all of its many chambers.

effects.description:
Unlocks Hero recruitment: Loremaster of Hoeth
	(all provinces)
Hero capacity: +1 for Loremasters of Hoeth
Hero recruit rank: +1 for Loremasters of Hoeth

Unlocks Hero recruitment: Loremaster of Hoeth
	(all provinces)
Hero capacity: +2 for Loremasters of Hoeth
Hero recruit rank: +2 for Loremasters of Hoeth

skillTree.localised_description: When Ulthuan marches to war, none go more eagerly than the Swordsmasters of Hoeth, for only in war can they truly unleash the full extent of their deadly art.

effects.description:
Weapon strength: +12% for embedded Loremaster of Hoeth Heroes and Swordmasters of Hoeth units
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +8 for embedded Loremaster of Hoeth Heroes and Swordmasters of Hoeth units
	(Lord's army)

Ward save: 10% for embedded Loremaster of Hoeth Heroes and Swordmasters of Hoeth units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Belannaer has studied warfare and personal combat for centuries now. It is said that he can slay a foe with but a touch, or kill with a single precisely-pitched whistle.

Amongst his many tasks he gathers information from the Sword Masters who roam the lands of Ulthuan, searching out Dark Elf spies and uncovering their destructive plots. When the enemies of the White Tower strike he will be ready, and the Sword Masters shall accompany him as they march to do battle.

At the time when the Norse began raiding Ulthuan in earnest Belannaer was one of the wizards whose magic shrouded the coast of Ulthuan in a maze of spells, making it almost impossible for raiders to reach the Elven Kingdoms.

effects.description:
Leadership: +10 when in own or allied territory
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +5 when in own or allied territory
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The Wizard draws wholesome energies from the soil, imbuing companions with the natural resilience of the earth.

skillTree.localised_description: Calling upon the beast spirits of the wild, the caster sheathes vulnerable flesh in unyielding fur and hide.

Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Pann's Impenetrable Pelt Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: The Wizard destroys their enemies from within, corroding foes' minds with doubt and crisis.

skillTree.localised_description: Even the simplest of spells can bring forth the full bloom of renewal, reinvigorating and healing the broken and bleeding.
The spellcaster attunes the magic of the wild, channelling its ancient and arcane power.
A conjured shadow is just as obfuscating as a real one - the Shadow Wizard is master or mistress of the 'concealing' arts.
There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +75
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Turning an untrained bunch of regular citizens into effective fighting units requires a special kind of talent, and oodles of patience.

skillTree.localised_description: Knowing that it is the rare plan that survives contact with the enemy, yet being prepared for all eventualities, raises this one above mere planners.

skillTree.localised_description: Like a wall of the hardest stone imaginable - such is their ability to withstand attack.

skillTree.localised_description: Speed, agility and control - all must be mastered if your crushing tide is to break perfectly upon enemy shores.

skillTree.localised_description: The very centre of the fire always burns the hottest.

skillTree.localised_description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
"Let your name be on the lips of every man and woman; your great deeds go before you!"
Sickness must be purged, and purge it shall be!

effects.description:
Construction cost: -5% for Worship buildings
	(all provinces)

Construction cost: -10% for Worship buildings
	(all provinces)

skillTree.localised_description: The Lords rule, the peasants toil. Nothing has changed in over a thousand years.
This warrior has been ambushed previously and got themselves and many of their compatriots away safely. Such things make one naturally suspicious.
Someone has to ensure the numbers and quality of recruits remain high.
"The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: A good quartermaster can ration equipment and foodstuffs efficiently, making supplies last longer.
The ancient Asur arts teach one how to heal as well as how to harm.

effects.description:
Attrition: -10% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -20% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -30% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Far removed from the petty squabbles of other races, many High Elves are able to devote themselves to learning, magic and the arts.
This Lord's many deeds - both on and off the battlefield - have brought them renown among their allies and made them feared by their enemies.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +25% chance of wounding aggressors

factionEffects.localised_description: Magic courses through the blood of Sapherian Elves, and all of the realm's princes are also mages of awesome power.

effects.description:
Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +5
	(all armies)
Diplomatic relations: +60 with the faction of Order of Loremasters

Recruitment duration: -1 turn for Swordmasters of Hoeth units (minimum 1)
	(all provinces)

items.colour_text: The Loremaster of Hoeth wears an enchanted cloak. The runes woven into its fabric tell of the virtues of wisdom, patience and self-control. They warn that violence is not a path to wisdom. Those that attack the wearer of the cloak will feel the weight of the world resting ever heavier on them, and their blows lack strength and purpose.

effects.description:
Diplomatic relations: +20 with Humans and High Elves
	(factionwide)

items.colour_text: The Book of the Phoenix tells the ancient legend of Asuryan – an allegorical story of the fate of all civilizations, of birth, growth, glory, decline and eventual destruction. By reading one of the verses of the book, Belannaer may gain one of several effects, unless the book is destroyed or nullified by some means.

ui_effects.localised_text: Greatly replenishes hit points of combatants

target_if: Hit point replenishment cap not reached

backgroundSkills.localised_description: "Enlightenment is achieved by mastering not only the body, but the soul. Only then can a warrior truly understand the value of life and why it should be protected at all costs."

effects.description:
Upkeep: -30% for Swordmasters of Hoeth units
	(Lord's army)

Leadership: +10 for Swordmasters of Hoeth units
	(Lord's army)
